post.description:
Sending funds via Brick allows you to perform digital fund transfers, and Brick currently supports fund transfers to financial accounts and e-wallets. Before you can send out funds, you will need to make sure that there are sufficient funds in your account with Brick for disbursements to be possible. To do that, deposit funds to your Brick account.

Before using this API, it is suggested to use **Account Verification API** to validate the recipient's account.

parameters.name: publicAccessToken
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for Client(Public access token), It should be called with bearer

referenceId.description: A unique reference ID as a unique identifier

description.description: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users what the transaction was for. Description length limit is 1000 chars.

amount.description: Amount that you would like to send

message.example: We have received your request and are processing it, please check your callback URL for transaction status
Please use amount more than minimum transfer limit, ie:10.000

action.example: Please make sure the amount you requested is in the range of Rp 10.000 to Rp 100.000.000

reason.example: Your amount of transfer is below our minimum transfer amount

message.example: Please use valid bankShortCode in the request query

action.example: Please revalidate your bank short code https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1OvnDKPnQ0nAdFq8PLyvOjrZlfeVMtu8WE2HymmoY8Og/edit#gid=0

reason.example: bankShortCode is not valid in the request query

message.example: Callback URL is not available

action.example: Please add the callback URL from dashboard or contact contact sales team

reason.example: This is Async API, Final response will be sended over callback URL

message.example: Please make sure your External key (reference id) has never been used before

action.example: Please make sure to always use unique reference ID in the parameter

reason.example: Your external id (referenceId) has already been taken

message.example: Please use valid Public_access_token in headers

action.example: Please generate valid public access token via /v2/payments/auth/token APIs or contact to Brick sales team

reason.example: Invalid public_access_token in headers

message.example: Please make sure you have sufficient fund to process this transaction

action.example: Please do the top up to proceed this transactions

reason.example: Your Account has insufficient funds to process this transaction

message.example: Requested bank for transfer is currently unavailable

action.example: Please wait and retry again

reason.example: Institution is currently under maintainence

get.description:
This API helps you to retrieve the past disbursement
Note: A real transaction is only available in a production environment.

parameters.name: contractId
parameters.description: Unique identifier to identify the transaction

parameters.name: publicAccessToken
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for Client(Public access token), It should be called with bearer

message.example: We have successfuly retrieve your disbursement
Please use valid Public_access_token in headers

action.example: Please generate valid public access token via /v2/payments/auth/token APIs or contact to Brick sales team

reason.example: Invalid public_access_token in headers

message.example: contract_id_invalid

action.example: Please check again the request/data

reason.example: Error on request or data

parameters.name: publicAccessToken
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for Client(Public access token), It should be called with bearer

bankShortCode.description: Institution short code of the bank

referenceId.description: Unique ID that is being generated by the client to track each VA generation (maximum 255 characters)

displayName.description: The display name that will be shown in the user's payment platform (maximum 24 characters)

message.example: We have successfully generated the open VA
Please use Bank Code that we support in the request query

action.example: Please revisit our API doc to see our supported Bank Code

reason.example: Bank Code is not supported

message.example: Please make sure your External key (reference id) has never been used before

action.example: Please make sure to always use unique reference ID in the parameter

reason.example: Your external id (referenceId) has already been taken

message.example: Please do not customize the suffix number for this Bank Code

action.example: Please use the suffix number given without customization

reason.example: Suffix number customization is not supported for this Bank Code

message.example: Please use valid Public_access_token in headers

action.example: Please generate valid public access token via /v2/payments/auth/token APIs or contact to Brick sales team

reason.example: Invalid public_access_token in headers

parameters.name: publicAccessToken
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for Client(Public access token), It should be called with bearer

paymentMethodType.description: Only virtual bank account is available for now

amount.description: The amount that will be stated in the virtual account

description.description: The description that will be stated in the virtual account (maximum 255 characters)

expiredAt.description: The expiration time of the close VA in Minute

referenceId.description: Unique ID that is being generated by the client to track each VA generation

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request POST 'https://sandbox.onebrick.io/v2/payments/gs/va/close' \
--header 'publicAccessToken: Bearer {{public-access-token}}' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{
    "amount": 15000,
    "referenceId": "brick12345",
    "expiredAt": "60",
    "description": "Test Initial VA Close",
    "bankShortCode": "MANDIRI",
    "displayName": "BRICK"
}'

get.description: This API helps verify the bank account to prevent error.

parameters.name: publicAccessToken
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for Client(Public access token), It should be called with bearer

parameters.name: accountNumber
parameters.description: Bank account Number

parameters.name: bankShortCode
parameters.description: Brick's bankShortCode for official bank (e.g Bank Mandiri -> Mandiri)

bankShortCode.description: This should be the institution that your end-customer intends to receive funds in. Please see list bank destination for full list of bank accounts you can send to.

message.example: We are successfully able to verify the account
Please use valid and active accountNumber in request query

action.example: Please verify the account number in /v2/payments/bank-account-validation API

reason.example: accountNumber is invalid in request body

message.example: Please use the API with bankShortCode in the request param

action.example: Please revisit the API docs to know more about the required fields in API

reason.example: bankShortCode  is missing from request param

message.example: Please use valid bankShortCode in the request query

action.example: Please revalidate your bank short code https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1OvnDKPnQ0nAdFq8PLyvOjrZlfeVMtu8WE2HymmoY8Og/edit#gid=0

post.description: We need to build one standalone APIs for clients to consume of QRIS product. This APIs will help clients to create new dynamic QRIS for clients.

parameters.name: publicAccessToken
parameters.description: One time access-token generated using the auth token API

referenceId.description: Unique reference of Transactions from client side(Maximum length of 25 characters)

amount.description: Amount that clients wants to transfer

message.example: We have successfully generated the dynamic qris

post.description: We need to provide Cancel QRIS APIs to our clients, This APIs will help to cancel the QRIS and then will cant be use.

parameters.name: publicAccessToken
parameters.description: One time access-token generated using the auth token API

parameters.name: referecneId
parameters.description: Unique reference of Transactions from client side

post.description: The BIFAST Disbursement service offers two distinct packages: BIFAST Only and Regular APIs. The BIFAST standalone disbursement APIs are designed for all of BRICKs users who wish to exclusively utilize BIFAST transactions for their disbursements. By utilizing BIFAST, users can benefit from real-time transactions at a significantly reduced cost.

parameters.name: publicAccessToken
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for Client(Public access token), It should be called with bearer

referenceId.description: A unique reference ID as a unique identifier

description.description: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users what the transaction was for. Description length limit is 1000 chars.

amount.description: Amount that you would like to send

name.description: Name of the user that transfer

countryCode.description: Country Code based on the user

provinceCode.description: Province Code based on the user

cityCode.description: City Code based on the user

jobCode.description: Job Code based on the user

  "status": 200,
  "message": "We have received your request and are processing it, please check your callback URL for transaction status",

post.description: Allows merchants to programmatically generate unique payment links tailored to specific transaction requirements, including amount, currency, and optional descriptions or attachments.

parameters.name: publicAccessToken
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for Client(Public access token), It should be called with bearer

amount.description: Amount the user need to transfer

referenceId.description: Unique ID that is being generated by the client to track each VA generation (maximum 255 characters)

redirectUrl.description: Redirect URL after the payment link

code-samples.code:
curl --location '{{url}}/v2/payments/gs/payment-link/status' \
--header 'publicAccessToken: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIzNDciLCJjb2xvdXIiOiIjMzMzMzMzIiwicm9sZSI6WyJVU0VSIl0sIm5hbWUiOiJQVCBKYXZhcyBKYXlhIEphdmEiLCJpc3MiOiJQVCBKYXZhcyBKYXlhIEphdmEiLCJleHAiOjE3MDkwMjYwMTUsImlhdCI6MTcwOTAyNTcxNSwianRpIjoiZWRjN2FiYzgtMWRlZS00Y2Y0LTk1YWItNDNjOTU3MTYyZTMyIiwidHMiOjE3MDkwMjU3MTUyMTV9.AFERdbkKCvTyCUg4JgnQYp4dKDCRGY9ocw9RJV18qaI' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data '{
    "referenceId": "28641922ff2d43b0a5cd08793cf9cbf2",(REQUIRED)
    "pin":"1111"(REQUIRED if files attached)
}'
